file_content.text: If you want me to hand over the Willsaams, you should head to the front and defend against the Ulgo attack.
Aren't you impatient to devastate Castle Organa? You got what you wanted; please leave.
You... you are cruelty. I hope my Organa brothers cut you to shreds as you try to invade our castle.
I expect a challenging fight.
No doubt they will try.
Don't hold your breath.
Won't happen.
Just leave. Leave me to my misery. Blenks, I'm sorry I failed you....
As ruthless as you are, Sith, I'm grateful for your mercy. Still, I hope invading Castle Organa proves to be your undoing.
You're going to be sorely disappointed.
Don't count on it.
I'm sure it will be a challenging fight.
Only time will tell.
I just spared your love and you're wishing death on me? How rude.
That's the thanks I get?
Please, you got what you wanted, just go.
I have only a ragtag troop defending this tunnel, and Ulgo is about to attack. You must repel the enemy forces.
You'd better hold up your end of the deal.
Don't renege.
I am a woman of my word.
Consider it done.
It is strange to say to a Sith, but you have my and House Organa's thanks.
I take issue with the word "must."
Don't order me around.
You're right. I'm fortunate to have the benefit of your services.
Here, take this transponder device. It's something we use for spies and other hostiles who are working for us.
It sends a signal to my troops not to attack you. This way, I won't lose more men as you leave. Please activate it.
That will make things much more efficient.
Good idea.
Now I have complete immunity.
I can walk among the enemy
We change the signal every day, and I can disrupt it anytime I please. So that device will only keep my soldiers at bay for so long.
I'm not sparing anyone. Your men will be a warm-up.
Forget it.
Do what you must, Sith. But if sense claims you, just activate the transponder when you leave my headquarters.
What's left of my forces at the tunnel choke point are being led by Lieutenant Dargus.
I'll let Dargus know you're coming. He'll contact me as soon as you've succeeded. Assuming you do.
You better hope I succeed.
Pray.
Unfortunately, all of my hope rides with you.
Don't worry.
I have a good feeling you won't.
Your lack of faith is an insult, Gesselle.
Don't doubt me.
Believe me, I know you're my best chance.
Goodbye, Sith. As uncomfortable as it is to say, I hope we speak again soon.
General, our standing army outside is being wiped out! Someone or something is on its way here.
My technicians almost have the force field reset, but we're still a sitting duck!
There have been several assassinations of House Thul officials whose security systems were downed by the generator explosion. In my opinion, House Ulgo is behind all this.
Your opinion is about to change. I'm here for information on Jaesa Willsaam's family.
Wrong.
Intruder!
Gesselle, get behind me!
None of you panic! I'll handle this.
Sith, did I hear you right? You've perpetrated all this in search of my former handmaiden?
Tell me where her family is, now!
Stop stalling.
I admire your singlemindedness.
Exactly.
Like me, you'll stop at nothing to achieve your goals.
I doubt you would have taken my call.
I prefer the direct approach.
It might have worked. I'm a practical woman.
You have decimated my forces outside. They were to be deployed to secure a part of my front that's about to fall.
Now I have no reinforcements. You seek information only I have, and my front needs bolstering. Perhaps we can help each other.
That sounds reasonable.
Deal.
I'm glad we see eye to eye.
I'll kill your entourage one by one until you give me what I want.
Talk or else.
Go ahead. I'm not a commander with a soft heart. My actions are always dictated by the big picture.
Kan'grell, Prinn and Blenks knew the risks of serving a general. It will be a waste of effort to kill them.
Even if you destroy my flea of a servant, you'll still get nothing from me unless you agree to defend my front from Ulgo.
I will not back down.
You'll cave. [Choke Blenks]
This is futile. I'll fight off the Ulgo attack for you.
Fine, you win.
Glad to hear it. I only wish you'd agreed sooner. I wouldn't have this huge mess to clean up.
So be it. Might as well kill him, too.
But it's fun. [Choke Blenks]
This isn't working, Sith... I'm not so easily... broken....
No, stop! Please. Blenks is my lover. I'll tell you everything, just please don't kill him.
Jaesa Willsaam's parents are servants in Castle Organa! They are stationed in the central tower!
He--here... take this! It's a pass key that will gain you entry to their chamber, just please stop choking Blenks!
Your man gets to live.
Thank you. [Release Blenks]
Blenks, I'm sorry. It's going to be alright now.
It will be more satisfying to kill you!
He lives but you die. [Kill]
I should have known better than to strike a deal with you!
Your stubbornness has sealed his fate.
No. [Kill Blenks]
No! Oh Blenks, my love....
I'll defend your front, but tell me what I wish to know first.
Give me a show of good faith.
I am not so gullible. I'll tell you about Jaesa Willsaam's parents after my front is defended.
Now, on my left flank, there's a tunnel between my forces and House Ulgo's that has been hard-pressed by the enemy.
If you wouldn't mind removing yourself from here, I have a lot to clean up and a war to run.
Unless you tell me, Kan'grell dies.
[Choke military advisor]
The good of the many must dictate my actions.
Kan'grell has served me well, but if we lose the war, his life is likely forfeit anyway. I won't cry out to stop you.
What a waste. Threatening my people won't work. If you defend my front against the Ulgo attack, you will get what you want.
Prinn is the oldest. Perhaps a father figure for you? Your stubbornness betrays him.
[Choke lead technician]
I will not be swayed by this kind of tactic.
I have known Prinn most of my life, and if you persist until he dies, I shall miss him. But I am not deterred.
So, are you satisfied yet? Only one of my people is left. Must you kill him as well?
Talk fast. He doesn't have much time left.
Tell me now or he dies.
I think I'll kill your love anyway.
He still dies. [Kill Blenks]
I'm glad this senseless killing is over with.
I'm relieved. [Release Blenks]
I knew you were all talk. Pathetic.
You're weak. [Release Blenks]
The parents of Jaesa Willsaam are servants in Castle Organa. They work in the central tower there.
You've won. You've called my bluff and humiliated me. Take my pass key. It will gain you access to the Willsaam's chamber.
You're lucky I'm in a good mood.
Be thankful for my mercy.
Thank you.
You're just saying that because you're mad.
Your feelings are hurt.
I'll fight off the Ulgo attack for you.
Fine, I agree.
I'm relieved. Now I won't have to replace my entire entourage.
Blenks is the youngest here. He has so much life yet to live.
[Choke young servant]
Kan'grell is the most useful of your people. Your campaign suffers intensely without him.
[Choke military advisor]
I'll be merciful and start with Blenks. Servants are replaceable.
[Choke young servant]
Prinn is dying, Gesselle. Only you can stop it.
[Choke lead technician]
You... you killed them all. And my beloved Gesselle. Why? She gave you what you wanted.
I am misery. If it gives you pleasure to cause such anguish, get an eyeful and then leave. You have what you came for.
Just be glad you're still breathing.
You could be dead, too.
You're young. You'll find someone else.
You'll get over it.
There is no one like her.
It's in my nature.
I'm Sith.
Gesselle should have known better.
You sealed your fate. [Kill]
